full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 120 of 247 248 LBUCmax3 Visoski - cross 1 A. Absolutely. 2 Q. And you certainly didn't think that Epstein had any ulterior motive for being generous to your daughters, did you? 3 4 A. No. 5 Q. And he never asked you for anything in return, did he? 6 A. No. 7 Q. Mr. Visoski, are you aware that Epstein had back problems? 8 A. He complained about back problems, yes. 9 Q. Are you aware he often used a heating pad on his back? 10 A. Yes. 11 Q. And are you aware that he often got massages on a regular basis for the same reason? 12 13 A. Yes, he did. Yes. 14 Q. Now, for example, when you flew to the ranch in New Mexico, the ranch manager would sometimes arrange massages for Epstein; isn't that right? 15 16 17 A. It's what I heard from the ranch manager, yes. 18 Q. When the masseuses showed up, they were from a professional saloon in Santa Fe? 19 20 A. To my knowledge, yes. 21 Q. That was called the Ten Thousand Waves; is that right? 22 A. I know that salon existed and it was famous for massage service, yes. 23 24 Q. And he received massages from both male and female masseuses; isn't that right? 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00017482
